text.section:
A health care provider that intends not to comply with an instruction of a health care agent or a surrogate shall:
Inform the person giving the instruction that:
The health care provider declines to carry out the instruction;
The person may request a transfer to another health care provider; and
The health care provider will make every reasonable effort to transfer the patient to another health care provider;
Assist in the transfer; and
Pending the transfer, comply with an instruction of a competent individual, or of a health care agent or surrogate for an individual who is incapable of making an informed decision, if a failure to comply with the instruction would likely result in the death of the individual.

Nothing in this section authorizes a health care provider to provide health care to:
A competent individual over the objection of that individual; or
An individual incapable of making an informed decision over the objection of another person authorized by law to consent to the provision of health care for the individual.
